result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • SCOTT M HOLLIS was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail credit to be applied to conditional jail time imposed

IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
IMPOSED.  With Good Time.  With HUBER if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant taken into custody and transported to the Winnebago County Jail.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample, upon arrival at the jail. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52

records.addlTxt: 02:33 PM Defendant SCOTT M HOLLIS in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.

records.addlTxt: 8:34 AM Defendant SCOTT M HOLLIS in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request to adjourn plea/sentencing due to modified offer.  No objections.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
submitted by Atty Goldin requesting adjournment of 5/17/22 jury trial.

09:18 AM Defendant SCOTT M HOLLIS in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:34 AM Defendant SCOTT M HOLLIS in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 8:37.  Arraignment scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

in support of OWI Search Warrant

OWI 4TH, BATTERY OR THREAT TO LEO-2CTS: CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.   No alcohol consumption or possession. Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.

02:39 PM Defendant SCOTT M HOLLIS in court, in custody.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SCOTT M HOLLIS appeared by video means. Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. DNA expungement rights given.   The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 242  Further proceedings scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
